title: A Child Offered Us a Quail in a Slipper of Rose Coloured Satin
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA; Charles Sessler, Inc., Philadelphia, PA, until November 1957; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, November 1957 until February 8, 1960 [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1960 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Charles Sessler, Inc. invoiced Mrs. Beal $100 for the drawing (for Anabasis no. 4) on October 28, 1957. Payment was sent on November 7, 1957 and acknowledged on November 12, 1957. The drawing was mailed to Mrs. Beal in late November 1957, care of Carnegie Institute, after the close of the Spruance exhibition at Sessler Gallery (see curatorial file.) 
[2]. The drawing was accessioned on February 8, 1960.
